name: OSPREY
author: Georg Oeltzschner, Helge J. ZÃ¶llner, Richard A. E. Edden, Erik G. Lee
description: Osprey is an all-in-one software suite for state-of-the art processing and quantitative analysis of in-vivo magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS) data.
command-line: true [DERIVATIVES_PREFIX]; true [SubjectDirectory] ; rm -f CbrainBidsSingleSubject/[SubjectDirectory] ; cp -p -R -L [SubjectDirectory] CbrainBidsSingleSubject/[SubjectDirectory] ; osprey CbrainBidsSingleSubject [OSPREYOutputDirectoryName] participant [JSONConfig] [ParticipantLabel] [SessionLabel] [CabinetOutput] [LocalizerRegistration] [LocSearchTerm] [PreferredAnatModality] [TermsNotAllowedInAnat] [RequireSUIDMatch]

inputs.name: Subject Directory
inputs.description: The study-wide BIDS directory. In CBRAIN this is also referred to (and used) as the subject directory since a new BIDS dir will be made for the selected subject prior to processing.

inputs.name: OSPREY Output Directory
inputs.description: The name of the output directory to store outcomes of preprocessing and reports. When processing is ran via CBRAIN only subject-specific files/folders will be saved, so the naming of the output folder will not influence the final naming/destination of files/folders.

inputs.name: JSON Config File
inputs.description: The JSON file used to configure OSPREY processing.

inputs.name: Participant Label
inputs.description: Space delimited list of subjects to be processed (with or without sub- prefix)

inputs.name: Session Label
inputs.description: select a specific session to be processed (with or without ses- prefix)

inputs.name: CABINET Output
inputs.description: The output folder from a previously computed CABINET run. This will provide OSPREY with a segmentation map to do partial volume correction. The pipeline will look for CabinetOutput/precomputed/sub*/ses*/anat/*_space-orig_desc-aseg_dseg.nii.gz)

inputs.name: Localizer Registration
inputs.description: Align the anatomical reference to a localizer scan. If this flag is used, processing will be skipped for sessions without a scan in the anat dir with *localizer* in the name.

inputs.name: PreferredAnatModality
inputs.description: The preferred modality to use for anatomical images (must be one of: T1w, T2w, none). If set to none, no anatomical information will be used in processing. This can be of interest for QC purposes.

inputs.name: TermsNotAllowedInAnat
inputs.description: One or more terms, seperated by spaces, that have to be absent for a file to be considered an anatomical scan. Mainly useful for avoiding confusion between primary anat and localizer scans.

inputs.name: Require MRS/Localizer Study Instance UID Match
inputs.description: If activated, OSPREY will only try to match MRS scans with localizers if the StudyInstanceUID field in the BIDS JSON matches across the localizer/mrs images.

inputs.name: JSON of CABINET Output
inputs.description: The JSON file that come with the output folder from a previously computed CABINET run.

inputs.name: derivatives_prefix
inputs.description: Folders to put before the pipeline specific folder. By default this will look like DataProvider/derivatives/PipelineName, where pipeline name is specific to the current pipeline. The provided string must end in /

groups.name: Segmentation directory content
groups.description: File(s) to put in the precomputed folder for --segmentation-dir option

output-files.name: Output Directory
output-files.description: The output directory to store outcomes of preprocessing and reports
